title: Fault-Tolerant Immerman-Szelepcsenyi for Coordination
significance: Complementation is FREE even under Byzantine faults!

new_questions.question: What is the optimal Byzantine agreement protocol for distributed counting?
new_questions.notes: Our protocol uses general Byzantine agreement; specialized counting protocols might be faster

new_questions.question: Can the O(N * log N) state overhead be reduced for specific problems?
new_questions.notes: Some problems might allow sublinear state even under Byzantine

new_questions.question: Does CC-LOGSPACE-Byzantine = CC-NLOGSPACE-Byzantine?
new_questions.notes: Mirrors Q211; likely hard as it's analog of L vs NL

new_questions.question: What is the exact f-threshold for complementation to remain free?
new_questions.notes: f < N/3 works; does f < N/2 work for weaker results?

new_questions.question: Can we achieve subquadratic rounds for Byzantine Immerman-Szelepcsenyi?
new_questions.notes: O(log^2 N) might not be tight; O(log N * log log N) possible?
